017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
020import java.lang.reflect.Executable;
021import java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType;
022import java.lang.reflect.GenericDeclaration;
023import java.lang.reflect.Method;
024import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
025import java.lang.reflect.Type;
026import java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable;
027import java.lang.reflect.WildcardType;
028
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.Collection;
031import java.util.Collections;
032import java.util.List;
033import java.util.Map;
034import java.util.Objects;
035
036import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;
037
038/**
039 * A {@link org.microbean.type.Type} that models a {@link
040 * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type} for use primarily by
041 * a {@link org.microbean.type.Type.Semantics} instance.
042 *
043 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
044 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
045 *
046 * @see org.microbean.type.Type.Semantics
047 */
048@Experimental
049public class JavaType extends org.microbean.type.Type<Type> {
050
051
052  /*
053   * Static fields.
054   */
055
056
057  /**
058   * An immutable {@link Map} of Java wrapper {@linkplain Class
059   * classes} indexed by their primitive equivalents.
060   */
061  public static final Map<Type, Class<?>> wrapperTypes =
062    Map.of(boolean.class, Boolean.class,
063           byte.class, Byte.class,
064           char.class, Character.class,
065           double.class, Double.class,
066           float.class, Float.class,
067           int.class, Integer.class,
068           long.class, Long.class,
069           short.class, Short.class,
070           void.class, Void.class);
071
072
073  /*
074   * Instance fields.
075   */
076
077
078  private final boolean box;
079
080
081  /*
082   * Constructors.
083   */
084
085
086  /**
087   * Creates a new {@link JavaType} with no autoboxing.
088   *
089   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the Java {@link Type}
090   * being modeled; must not be {@code null}
091   *
092   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
093   *
094   * @see #JavaType(Token, boolean)
095   */
096  public JavaType(final Token<?> type) {
097    this(type.type(), false);
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Creates a new {@link JavaType}.
102   *
103   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the Java {@link Type}
104   * being modeled; must not be {@code null}
105   *
106   * @param box whether boxing of primitive types will be in effect;
107   * even if {@code true} boxing only happens to primitive types
108   *
109   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
110   */
111  public JavaType(final Token<?> type, final boolean box) {
112    this(type.type(), box);
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Creates a new {@link JavaType} with no autoboxing.
117   *
118   * @param type the {@link Type} being modeled; must not be {@code
119   * null}
120   *
121   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
122   *
123   * @see #JavaType(Type, boolean)
124   */
125  public JavaType(final Type type) {
126    this(type, false);
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Creates a new {@link JavaType}.
131   *
132   * @param type the Java {@link Type} being modeled; must not be {@code null}
133   *
134   * @param box whether boxing of primitive types will be in effect;
135   * even if {@code true} boxing only happens to primitive types
136   *
137   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
138   */
139  public JavaType(final Type type, final boolean box) {
140    super(type);
141    this.box = box;
142  }
143
144
145  /*
146   * Instance methods.
147   */
148
149  /**
150   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
151   * represents a Java type that has a name.
152   *
153   * <p>In the Java reflective type system, only {@link Class} and
154   * {@link TypeVariable} instances have names.</p>
155   *
156   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType} represents
157   * a Java type that has a name
158   *
159   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
160   * idempotent and deterministic.
161   *
162   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
163   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
164   *
165   * @see #name()
166   *
167   * @see Class#getName()
168   *
169   * @see TypeVariable#getName()
170   */
171  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
172  public boolean named() {
173    final Type type = this.object();
174    return type instanceof Class || type instanceof TypeVariable;
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Returns the name of this {@link JavaType} if it has one
179   * <strong>or {@code null} if it does not</strong>.
180   *
181   * <p>Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type
182   * system have names.</p>
183   *
184   * @return the name of this {@link JavaType}, or {@code null}
185   *
186   * @nullability This method and its overrides may, and often will,
187   * return {@code null}.
188   *
189   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent
190   * and deterministic.
191   *
192   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
193   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
194   */
195  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
196  public String name() {
197    final Type type = this.object();
198    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
199      return c.getName();
200    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
201      return tv.getName();
202    }
203    return null;
204  }
205
206  /**
207   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link JavaType} represents the same
208   * type as that represented by the supplied {@link Owner}.
209   *
210   * <p>Type representation is not the same thing as equality.
211   * Specifically, a {@link org.microbean.type.Type} may represent
212   * another {@link org.microbean.type.Type} exactly, but may not be
213   * {@linkplain org.microbean.type.Type#equals(Object) equal to}
214   * it.</p>
215   *
216   * <p>Equality is <em>subordinate</em> to type representation.  That
217   * is, in determining whether a given {@link
218   * org.microbean.type.Type} represents another {@link
219   * org.microbean.type.Type}, their {@link
220   * org.microbean.type.Type#equals(Object) equals(Object)} methods
221   * may be called, but a {@link org.microbean.type.Type}'s {@link
222   * org.microbean.type.Type#equals(Object) equals(Object)} method
223   * must not call {@link
224   * org.microbean.type.Type#represents(Owner)}.</p>
225   *
226   * @param <X> the type representation type used by the supplied
227   * {@link Owner}
228   *
229   * @param other the {@link Owner} to test; may be {@code null} in
230   * which case {@code false} will be returned
231   *
232   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Type} represents the same
233   * thing as that represented by the supplied {@link Owner}
234   *
235   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
236   * idempotent and deterministic.
237   *
238   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
239   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
240   */
241  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
242  public <X> boolean represents(final Owner<X> other) {
243    if (super.represents(other)) {
244      return true;
245    }
246    // TODO: other stuff; could use the equivalent of JavaTypes.toString() here
247    return false;
248  }
249
250  /**
251   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the return value of {@link
252   * #object()} is identical to {@link Object Object.class}.
253   *
254   * @return {@code true} if and only if the return value of {@link
255   * #object()} is identical to {@link Object Object.class}
256   *
257   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
258   *
259   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
260   * threads.
261   */
262  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
263  public final boolean top() {
264    return this.object() == Object.class;
265  }
266
267  /**
268   * If this {@link JavaType} represents a primitive type, and if and
269   * only if boxing was enabled in the {@linkplain #JavaType(Type,
270   * boolean) constructor}, returns a {@link JavaType} representing
271   * the corresponding "wrapper type", or this {@link JavaType} itself
272   * in all other cases.
273   *
274   * @return a {@link JavaType} representing the corresponding "wrapper
275   * type" where appropriate, or {@code this}
276   *
277   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
278   * return {@code null}.
279   *
280   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
281   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
282   *
283   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
284   * idempotent and deterministic.
285   *
286   * @see org.microbean.type.Type#box()
287   */
288  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
289  public JavaType box() {
290    if (this.box) {
291      final Type type = this.object();
292      if (type == void.class) {
293        return of(Void.class, true);
294      } else if (type == int.class) {
295        // This is such a ridiculously common case we avoid the map lookup
296        return of(Integer.class, true);
297      } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c && c.isPrimitive()) {
298        return of(wrapperTypes.get(c), true);
299      }
300    }
301    return this;
302  }
303
304  /**
305   * Returns an {@linkplain
306   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable and
307   * immutable <code>Collection</code>} of the <em>direct
308   * supertypes</em> of this {@link JavaType}, or an {@linkplain
309   * Collection#isEmpty() empty <code>Collection</code>} if there are
310   * no direct supertypes.
311   *
312   * <p>This implementation uses the {@link
313   * JavaTypes#directSupertypes(Type)} method.</p>
314   *
315   * @return an {@linkplain
316   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable and
317   * immutable <code>Collection</code>} of the <em>direct
318   * supertypes</em> of this {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
319   *
320   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
321   * return {@code null}.
322   *
323   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
324   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
325   *
326   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
327   * idempotent and deterministic.
328   */
329  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
330  public Collection<JavaType> directSupertypes() {
331    final Collection<Type> directSupertypes = JavaTypes.directSupertypes(this.object());
332    if (!directSupertypes.isEmpty()) {
333      final Collection<JavaType> c = new ArrayList<>(directSupertypes.size());
334      for (final Type type : directSupertypes) {
335        c.add(of(type, this.box));
336      }
337      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(c);
338    }
339    return List.of();
340  }
341
342  /**
343   * If this {@link JavaType} represents a {@link ParameterizedType}
344   * or a {@link GenericArrayType} returns a {@link JavaType}
345   * representing its {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw
346   * type} or {@linkplain GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType()
347   * generic component type}, or, if this {@link JavaType} does not
348   * represent a {@link ParameterizedType} or a {@link
349   * GenericArrayType}, returns {@code this}.
350   *
351   * @return a suitable {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}; often {@code
352   * this}
353   *
354   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
355   * return {@code null}.
356   *
357   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
358   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
359   *
360   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
361   * idempotent and deterministic.
362   */
363  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
364  public JavaType type() {
365    final Type type = this.object();
366    if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
367      return of(p.getRawType(), this.box);
368    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
369      return of(g.getGenericComponentType(), this.box);
370    } else {
371      return this;
372    }
373  }
374
375  /**
376   * Returns the owner of this {@link JavaType} as an {@link Object},
377   * suitable only for equality comparisons, or {@code null} if this
378   * {@link JavaType} does not represent either a {@link Class}, a
379   * {@link ParameterizedType} or a {@link TypeVariable}.
380   *
381   * @return the owner of this {@link JavaType}, or {@code null}
382   *
383   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
384   * {@code null}.
385   *
386   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
387   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
388   *
389   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
390   * and deterministic.
391   */
392  @Experimental
393  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
394  public Owner<Type> owner() {
395    final Type type = this.object();
396    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
397      return of(c.getEnclosingClass());
398    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
399      return of(p.getOwnerType());
400    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
401      final GenericDeclaration gd = tv.getGenericDeclaration();
402      if (gd instanceof Class<?> c) {
403        return of(c, this.box);
404      } else if (gd instanceof Executable e) {
405        return new JavaExecutable(e, this.box);
406      } else {
407        throw new AssertionError("gd: " + gd);
408      }
409    } else {
410      return null;
411    }
412  }
413
414  /**
415   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
416   * represents a generic {@link Class} by virtue of having
417   * {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}.
418   *
419   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
420   * {@link #object()} is an instance of {@link Class} and, if so, if
421   * that {@link Class} {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() has any
422   * type parameters}.
423   *
424   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
425   * a generic class by virtue of having {@linkplain
426   * Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}
427   *
428   * @see #object()
429   *
430   * @see #typeParameters()
431   */
432  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
433  public boolean hasTypeParameters() {
434    return this.object() instanceof Class<?> c && c.getTypeParameters().length > 0;
435  }
436
437  /**
438   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
439   * a {@link ParameterizedType} by virtue of {@linkplain
440   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() having type
441   * arguments}.
442   *
443   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
444   * {@link #object()} is a {@link ParameterizedType}.</p>
445   *
446   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
447   * a parameterized type by virtue of having {@linkplain
448   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type arguments}
449   *
450   * @see #object()
451   *
452   * @see #typeArguments()
453   */
454  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
455  public boolean hasTypeArguments() {
456    return this.object() instanceof ParameterizedType;
457  }
458
459  /**
460   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
461   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s type
462   * arguments.
463   *
464   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
465   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link JavaType} models a
466   * {@link ParameterizedType}.</p>
467   *
468   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
469   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s
470   * {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type
471   * arguments}; never {@code null}
472   *
473   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
474   * return {@code null}.
475   *
476   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
477   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
478   *
479   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
480   * idempotent and deterministic.
481   */
482  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
483  public List<JavaType> typeArguments() {
484    if (this.object() instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
485      final Type[] typeArguments = p.getActualTypeArguments();
486      final List<JavaType> typeArgumentsList = new ArrayList<>(typeArguments.length);
487      for (final Type typeArgument : typeArguments) {
488        typeArgumentsList.add(of(typeArgument, this.box));
489      }
490      return Collections.unmodifiableList(typeArgumentsList);
491    }
492    return List.of();
493  }
494
495  /**
496   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
497   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s type
498   * parameters.
499   *
500   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
501   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link JavaType} models a generic
502   * {@link Class}.</p>
503   *
504   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
505   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s
506   * {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}; never
507   * {@code null}
508   *
509   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
510   * return {@code null}.
511   *
512   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
513   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
514   *
515   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
516   * idempotent and deterministic.
517   */
518  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
519  public List<JavaType> typeParameters() {
520    if (this.object() instanceof Class<?> c) {
521      final Type[] typeParameters = c.getTypeParameters();
522      if (typeParameters.length > 0) {
523        final List<JavaType> typeParametersList = new ArrayList<>(typeParameters.length);
524        for (final Type typeParameter : typeParameters) {
525          typeParametersList.add(of(typeParameter, this.box));
526        }
527        return Collections.unmodifiableList(typeParametersList);
528      }
529    }
530    return List.of();
531  }
532
533  /**
534   * Returns the {@linkplain Class#getComponentType() component type}
535   * of this {@link JavaType}, if there is one, <strong>or {@code
536   * null} if there is not</strong>.
537   *
538   * <p>This method returns a non-{@code null} result only when this
539   * {@link JavaType} represents a {@link Type} that is either
540   * {@linkplain Class#isArray() an array} or a {@link
541   * GenericArrayType}.</p>
542   *
543   * @return the {@linkplain Class#getComponentType() component type}
544   * of this {@link JavaType}, if there is one, or {@code null} if
545   * there is not
546   *
547   * @nullability This method and its overrides may return null.
548   *
549   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
550   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
551   *
552   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
553   * idempotent and deterministic.
554   *
555   * @see Class#getComponentType()
556   *
557   * @see GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType()
558   */
559  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
560  public JavaType componentType() {
561    final Type newType;
562    final Type type = this.object();
563    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
564      newType = c.getComponentType();
565    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
566      newType = g.getGenericComponentType();
567    } else {
568      newType = null;
569    }
570    if (newType == null) {
571      return null;
572    }
573    return of(newType, this.box);
574  }
575
576  /**
577   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
578   * represents either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
579   * WildcardType}.
580   *
581   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
582   * {@link #object()} is either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
583   * WildcardType}.</p>
584   *
585   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
586   * represents either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
587   * WildcardType}
588   *
589   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
590   * idempotent and deterministic.
591   *
592   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
593   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
594   *
595   * @see #upperBounds()
596   */
597  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
598  public boolean upperBounded() {
599    final Type type = this.object();
600    return type instanceof WildcardType || type instanceof TypeVariable;
601  }
602
603  /**
604   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
605   * a {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
606   * with a lower bound}.
607   *
608   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
609   * {@link #object()} is a {@link WildcardType}, and, if so, if that
610   * {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
611   * has a lower bound}.</p>
612   *
613   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
614   * represents a {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain
615   * WildcardType#getLowerBounds() with a lower bound}
616   *
617   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
618   * idempotent and deterministic.
619   *
620   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
621   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
622   *
623   * @see #lowerBounds()
624   *
625   * @see WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
626   */
627  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
628  public boolean lowerBounded() {
629    final Type type = this.object();
630    return type instanceof WildcardType w && w.getLowerBounds().length > 0;
631  }
632
633  /**
634   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
635   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
636   * bounds.
637   *
638   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
639   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a {@link
640   * WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds() with a
641   * lower bound}.</p>
642   *
643   * <p>The returned {@link List} will contain at most one
644   * element.</p>
645   *
646   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
647   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
648   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
649   * empty}
650   *
651   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
652   * return {@code null}.
653   *
654   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
655   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
656   *
657   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
658   * idempotent and deterministic.
659   *
660   * @see WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
661   */
662  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
663  public List<JavaType> lowerBounds() {
664    final Type type = this.object();
665    if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
666      final Type[] lowerBounds = w.getLowerBounds();
667      if (lowerBounds.length > 0) {
668        final List<JavaType> lowerBoundsList = new ArrayList<>(lowerBounds.length);
669        for (final Type lowerBound : lowerBounds) {
670          lowerBoundsList.add(of(lowerBound, this.box));
671        }
672        return Collections.unmodifiableList(lowerBoundsList);
673      }
674    }
675    return List.of();
676  }
677
678  /**
679   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
680   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s upper
681   * bounds.
682   *
683   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
684   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models either a {@link
685   * WildcardType} or a {@link TypeVariable}.
686   *
687   * <p>The returned {@link List} will contain at most one
688   * element.</p>
689   *
690   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
691   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
692   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
693   * empty}
694   *
695   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
696   * return {@code null}.
697   *
698   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
699   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
700   *
701   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
702   * idempotent and deterministic.
703   *
704   * @see TypeVariable#getBounds()
705   *
706   * @see WildcardType#getUpperBounds()
707   */
708  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
709  public List<JavaType> upperBounds() {
710    final Type type = this.object();
711    if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
712      return List.of(of(w.getUpperBounds()[0], this.box));
713    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> t) {
714      final Type[] upperBounds = t.getBounds();
715      switch (upperBounds.length) {
716      case 0:
717        throw new AssertionError();
718      case 1:
719        return List.of(of(upperBounds[0], this.box));
720      default:
721        final List<JavaType> upperBoundsList = new ArrayList<>(upperBounds.length);
722        for (final Type upperBound : upperBounds) {
723          upperBoundsList.add(of(upperBound, this.box));
724        }
725        return Collections.unmodifiableList(upperBoundsList);
726      }
727    } else {
728      return List.of();
729    }
730  }
731
732  @Override // Object
733  public final int hashCode() {
734    return JavaTypes.hashCode(this.object());
735  }
736
737  @Override // Object
738  public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
739    if (other == this) {
740      return true;
741    } else if (other != null && this.getClass() == other.getClass()) {
742      return JavaTypes.equals(this.object(), ((JavaType)other).object());
743    } else {
744      return false;
745    }
746  }
747
748
749  /*
750   * Static methods.
751   */
752
753
754  /**
755   * Creates a new {@link JavaType} without autoboxing.
756   *
757   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the type to model; must
758   * not be {@code null}
759   *
760   * @return a new {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
761   *
762   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
763   *
764   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
765   *
766   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
767   * that it returns a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
768   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
769   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
770   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
771   * invocations are equal.
772   *
773   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
774   * threads.
775   *
776   * @see #of(Type, boolean)
777   */
778  public static JavaType of(final Token<?> type) {
779    return of(type, false);
780  }
781
782  /**
783   * Creates a new {@link JavaType}.
784   *
785   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the type to model; must
786   * not be {@code null}
787   *
788   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
789   *
790   * @return a new {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
791   *
792   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
793   *
794   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
795   *
796   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
797   * that it returns a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
798   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
799   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
800   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
801   * invocations are equal.
802   *
803   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
804   * threads.
805   *
806   * @see #of(Type, boolean)
807   */
808  public static JavaType of(final Token<?> type, final boolean box) {
809    return of(type.type(), box);
810  }
811
812  /**
813   * Creates a new {@link JavaType} without autoboxing.
814   *
815   * @param type the {@link Type} that will be modeled; must not be
816   * {@code null}
817   *
818   * @return a new {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
819   *
820   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
821   *
822   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
823   *
824   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
825   * that it returns a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
826   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
827   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
828   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
829   * invocations are equal.
830   *
831   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
832   * threads.
833   */
834  public static JavaType of(final Type type) {
835    return of(type, false);
836  }
837
838  /**
839   * Creates a new {@link JavaType}.
840   *
841   * @param type the {@link Type} that will be modeled; must not be
842   * {@code null}
843   *
844   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
845   *
846   * @return a new {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
847   *
848   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
849   *
850   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
851   *
852   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
853   * that it returns a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
854   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
855   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
856   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
857   * invocations are equal.
858   *
859   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
860   * threads.
861   *
862   * @see #of(Type)
863   */
864  public static JavaType of(final Type type, final boolean box) {
865    return new JavaType(type, box);
866  }
867
868
869  /*
870   * Inner and nested classes.
871   */
872
873
874  /**
875   * A holder of a {@link Type} that embodies <a
876   * href="http://gafter.blogspot.com/2006/12/super-type-tokens.html"
877   * target="_parent">Gafter's gadget</a>.
878   *
879   * <p>To use this class, create a new instance of an anonymous
880   * subclass of it, and then call {@link #type() type()} on it.  For
881   * example:</p>
882   *
883   * <blockquote><pre>
884   * // type will be a {@link ParameterizedType} whose {@link ParameterizedType#getRawType() rawType} is {@link java.util.List List.class} and
885   * // whose {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() sole type argument} is {@link String String.class}
886   * {@link Type} type = new {@link Token Token}&lt;{@link java.util.List List}&lt;{@link String}&gt;&gt;() {}.{@link #type() type()};</pre></blockquote>
887   *
888   * @param <T> the modeled type; often parameterized
889   *
890   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
891   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
892   *
893   * @see #type()
894   */
895  public static abstract class Token<T> {
896
897
898    /*
899     * Instance fields.
900     */
901
902
903    private final Type type;
904
905
906    /*
907     * Constructors.
908     */
909
910
911    /**
912     * Creates a new {@link Token}.
913     */
914    protected Token() {
915      super();
916      this.type = mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(this.getClass()).getActualTypeArguments()[0];
917    }
918
919
920    /*
921     * Instance methods.
922     */
923
924
925    /**
926     * Returns the {@link Type} modeled by this {@link Token}.
927     *
928     * @return the {@link Type} modeled by this {@link Token}; never
929     * {@code null}
930     *
931     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
932     *
933     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
934     * threads.
935     *
936     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
937     */
938    public final Type type() {
939      return this.type;
940    }
941
942    /**
943     * Returns the {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of
944     * this {@link Token}'s {@linkplain #type() modeled
945     * <code>Type</code>}, or {@code null} if erasing the {@link Type}
946     * would result in a non-{@link Class} erasure (in which case the
947     * erasure is simply the {@link Type} itself), or if an erasure
948     * cannot be determined.
949     *
950     * @return the {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of
951     * this {@link Token}'s {@linkplain #type() modeled
952     * <code>Type</code>}, or {@code null} if erasing the {@link Type}
953     * would result in a non-{@link Class} erasure, or if an erasure
954     * cannot be determined
955     *
956     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
957     *
958     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
959     * threads.
960     *
961     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
962     */
963    public final Class<?> erase() {
964      return JavaTypes.erase(this.type());
965    }
966
967    /**
968     * Returns a hashcode for this {@link Token} computed from the
969     * {@link Type} it {@linkplain #type() models}.
970     *
971     * @return a hashcode for this {@link Token}
972     *
973     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
974     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
975     *
976     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
977     * idempotent and deterministic.
978     *
979     * @see #equals(Object)
980     */
981    @Override // Object
982    public int hashCode() {
983      final Type type = this.type();
984      return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
985    }
986
987    /**
988     * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
989     * this {@link Token}.
990     *
991     * <p>This method returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link
992     * Object}'s {@linkplain Object#getClass() class} is this {@link
993     * Token}'s class and if its {@linkplain #type() modeled
994     * <code>Type</code>} is equal to this {@link Token}'s
995     * {@linkplain #type() modeled <code>Type</code>}.</p>
996     *
997     * @param other the {@link Object} to test; may be {@code null} in
998     * which case {@code false} will be returned
999     *
1000     * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1001     * this {@link Token}; {@code false} otherwise
1002     *
1003     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
1004     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1005     *
1006     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1007     * idempotent and deterministic.
1008     *
1009     * @see #hashCode()
1010     */
1011    @Override // Object
1012    public boolean equals(final Object other) {
1013      if (other == this) {
1014        return true;
1015      } else if (other instanceof Token<?> tt) {
1016        return Objects.equals(this.type(), tt.type());
1017      } else {
1018        return false;
1019      }
1020    }
1021
1022    /**
1023     * Returns a {@link String} representation of this {@link
1024     * Token}.
1025     *
1026     * <p>This method returns a value equal to that returned by {@link
1027     * Type#getTypeName() this.type().getTypeName()}.</p>
1028     *
1029     * @return a {@link String} representation of this {@link
1030     * Token}; never {@code null}
1031     *
1032     * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
1033     * return {@code null}.
1034     *
1035     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
1036     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1037     *
1038     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1039     * idempotent and deterministic.
1040     */
1041    @Override // Object
1042    public String toString() {
1043      final Type type = this.type();
1044      return type == null ? "null" : type.getTypeName();
1045    }
1046
1047
1048    /*
1049     * Static methods.
1050     */
1051
1052
1053    private static final ParameterizedType mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(final Type type) {
1054      if (type == null || type == Object.class || type == Token.class) {
1055        return null;
1056      } else {
1057        final Class<?> erasure = JavaTypes.erase(type);
1058        if (erasure == null || erasure == Object.class || !(Token.class.isAssignableFrom(erasure))) {
1059          return null;
1060        } else {
1061          return type instanceof ParameterizedType p ? p : mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(erasure.getGenericSuperclass());
1062        }
1063      }
1064    }
1065
1066
1067  }
1068
1069}
